_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Ammonia RefrigerationSafety Inspection Checklist Pressure Vessels
_prev_prog_3.Description: This facility mantains on OSHA Process Saftey Management Program modified to meet EPA Risk Management requirements designed to address off-site ammonia hazards to the public and environment.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE  SUMMARY

Trident Seafoods Anacortes processing facility uses anhydrous ammonia
as a refrigerant above the threshold quantity of 10,000 pounds to freeze
and store food products. The quantity of ammonia used requires an OSHA
Process Safety Management and the EPA Level 3 Risk Management Program
to assure the health and safety of on-site employees, off-site public and 
environmental receptors.

The facility?s refrigeration system uses standard materials, component, and 
industry guidelines which provide overlapping layers of refrigeration system
protection through automatic and manual reduction and mitigation of operating
deviations. System changes have been changed in kind and have only been
required to make a Management of Change on a new ice machine on 3/7/02. 
Standard operating procedures were written for ice machine. We review all SOP?s annually and make changes if needed.

No on-site or off-site ammonia related incident resulted in an injury, death, property
or environmental damage during the 5-year accident history period prepared for
the Risk Management Plan.

A ten minute unmitigated worst case release of 10,000 pounds of ammonia and
a ten minute unmitigated alternative release of 780 pound of ammonia were 
scenarios selected from EPA models and data to illustrate ammonia plume dispersion.

We will continue to do are best with the RMP and PSMP to have a safe plant.
 Jeff Johnson  4/20/04
